Issues.Title: [Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-alpha.1.23621.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox

### Issue description

[Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar

### Steps to reproduce

1. Open and run the attached reproduce application
[ScrollBarTest.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13782718/ScrollBarTest.zip)
2. Launch Inspect or Accessibility Insight tool
3. Focus on the entire cotnrol

**Actual result:**
1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/5a6b8c79-ce62-418c-a953-718e156e5e4d)
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/80b9973c-21a2-4ab5-bdd4-aafe5adf448b)
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/2f10ef12-224a-4613-bd46-3345bd379d95)

**Expected result:**
1. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0, not repro on 6.0 and previous version: FlowLayoutPanel, Panel, SplitContainer, TableLayoutPanel
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/3db13ec7-ee3c-44bf-9f4d-0e71d896116b)
2. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0/7.0/6.0, not repro on 5.0 and previous version: TabControl
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/2d0c015a-60ec-4ae7-a0bc-86160f85f191)
3. Controls repro on .NET 9.0/8.0, not repro on .NET 7.0 and previous version: TextBox
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/24c15fa2-d2f9-45d1-ac18-442b5380c3d4)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility]Inspect or AccessibilityInsights tool's rectangle can't focus on the entire FlowLayoutPanel/Panel/SplitContainer/TableLayoutPanel/TabControl/TextBox with scrollBar" (#10540)

Issues.Title: Cursor class does unnecessary finalization in some cases
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

8

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

unknown

### Issue description

Constructors for `Cursor` for the common case of system cursors should call `GC.SuppressFinalize(this)` so that the objects don't get unnecessarily queued for finalization.  This is currently what happens when a call is made to `Cursor.Current`.

pull request at
https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10538

### Steps to reproduce

n/a
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Cursor class does unnecessary finalization in some cases" (#10539)

Issues.Title: Update Cursor.cs avoid finalization if we don't need to free the unma…
Issues.Body:
call GC.SuppressFinalize(this) for constructors where we don't own the cursor handle so we can avoid being queued for finalization.

Issues.Title: Add Multiselect to FolderBrowserDialog
Issues.Body:
### Background and motivation

Allow selection of multiple folders.
In NET 7 I used code like this https://stackoverflow.com/a/48824688/5647513 (adapted) running [`OpenFileDialog`](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/9e2fc95fca4e6d18444c819b35bb1338ac6ca63d/src/System.Windows.Forms/src/System/Windows/Forms/Dialogs/CommonDialogs/FileDialog.Vista.cs#L23) with `FOS_PICKFOLDERS`. Some NET 8 preview introduced reflection unfriendly unsafe, so now I need official workaround.

### API Proposal

```diff
 class FolderBrowserDialog : CommonDialog
 {
+    public bool Multiselect { get; set; }
+    public string[] SelectedPaths { get; set; }
 }
```


### API Usage

<!---->

### Alternative Designs

WPF added `OpenFolderDialog` with [`Multiselect`](https://learn.microsoft.com/en-us/dotnet/api/microsoft.win32.openfolderdialog.multiselect?view=windowsdesktop-8.0) implemented in https://github.com/dotnet/wpf/issues/7689 via some nice hierarchy refactoring. I think WinForms may also benefit from `CommonItemDialog` base class. Introducing new base is not an issue, since they are sealed.

### Risks

_No response_

### Will this feature affect UI controls?

Yes.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed issue "Add Multiselect to FolderBrowserDialog" (#10535)

Issues.Title: Controls anchored Left+Right and/or Top+Bottom scale incorrectly when window is moved from high to low DPI screen in .NET 8
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.NET 8.0.0

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Yes

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

yes, works fine with 7.0.0

### Issue description

See attached sample application. 
In the .csproj file you can select the desired runtime. "net48" and "net7.0-windows" work fine, "net8.0-windows" doesn't.

Initial layout:
![grafik](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/6238104/fdc35664-1edd-4e9a-874a-aeb7a325a2aa)

Layout after moving from low to high and then high to low DPI screen:
![grafik](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/6238104/f946afaa-37d3-4241-92d0-8a0f7cec50b5)


Note: Setting "System.Windows.Forms.AnchorLayoutV2" in runtimeconfig.json to false or true doesn't make any difference.
(see https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/blob/main/docs/design/anchor-layout-changes-in-net80.md)

### Steps to reproduce

Start the application built for target framework "net8.0-windows" on a screen with 96dpi.
Move the window to the screen with higher DPI. So far so good.
Move the window back to the screen with 96 DPI and the Label control with yellow background has the wrong size.

[WinFormsScalingWithAnchor.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13766551/WinFormsScalingWithAnchor.zip)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "Controls anchored Left+Right and/or Top+Bottom scale incorrectly when window is moved from high to low DPI screen in .NET 8" (#10531)

Issues.Title: Cannot get the expected result when set "\r\r\n" to RichTextBox.Text property
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.0-alpha.1.23621.3

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

This issue can reproduce from .NET Core 3.1 ~ .NET 9.0

### Issue description

Cannot get the expected result when set "\r\r\n" to RichTextBox.Text property, **but set "\r\n" to RichTextBox.Text property which can get expected results,**

### Steps to reproduce

1. Launch the attached project in VS.
2. Run it and observe the value for richTextBox1.Text in debugging.
[Repo_Application.zip](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/files/13764392/Repo_Application.zip)

**Actual Results:**
There is “\ r \ n” in the string that the RichTextBox control can display line breaks normally.
There is “\ r\r \ n” in the string that the RichTextBox control cannot display line breaks.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/38325459/626f7eca-1520-4ee3-85ea-bd32b679340a)

**Expected Results:**
There is “\ r\r \ n” in the string that the RichTextBox control can display line breaks normally.

**More info:**
1. There is “\ r\r \ n” in the string that the TextBox control cannot display line breaks.
2.  This issue can reproduce from  .NET Framework 4.5 to 4.8.1.

Issues.Title: Prototype shared CsWin32 with System.Drawing.Common
Issues.Body:
This is a rough prototype of a shared interop with System.Drawing.Common. It introduces a new base assembly for shared CsWin32 and other low-level support code.

Converted HGLOBAL, DEVMODE and related stuff to the new shared pattern. Also used the CsWin32 generated GdiplusStartup.

I have almost no idea if packaging is correct here. Assuming it isn't.

`crefs` don't work right when there is overlap in internals. #10524 tracks this, and this change disables the relevant warnings.

I've only smoke tested this with the WinFormsControlsTest.


###### Microsoft Reviewers: [Open in CodeFlow](https://portal.fabricbot.ms/api/codeflow?pullrequest=https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10525)
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open PR "Prototype shared CsWin32 with System.Drawing.Common" (#10525)

Issues.Title: XML comment crefs unusable with shared/duplicate CsWin32
Issues.Body:
XML comment `cref`s don't resolve the same way code does. They have visibility to everything, which prevents us from using them when we have duplicate type names in dependent assemblies or types that cross assemblies. We either have to turn off [CS1574](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/csharp/misc/cs1574) and [CS1580](https://learn.microsoft.com/dotnet/csharp/misc/cs1574), or remove lots of existing `cref`s.

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10320#issuecomment-1858617614
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "XML comment crefs unusable with shared/duplicate CsWin32" (#10524)

Issues.Title: fix ToolStripItem SelectedChanged event is invoked twice
Issues.Body:
After PR [10321 add ToolStripItem.SelectedChanged event](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/pull/10321), tester raised a question: whether it is reasonable to fire SelectedChanged event **twice** when selection status turns from unselected to selected **and** from selected to unselected. After discussion we reached an agreement: the newly added API(ToolStripItem.SelectedChanged) should be consistent with framework's , i.e. when selection status turns from unselected to selected we will fire ToolStripItem.SelectedChanged event. but when selection status turns from selected to unselected we will **not**.

See the discussion [here](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/issues/8548#issuecomment-1862431770)

Winforms Team still would like to do a bit of investigation on the VS side of things so we can make sure that we don't run into something unexpected.

Issues.Title: Use Cswin32 UIA_X_ID Enums
Issues.Body:
Previously metadata had incorrectly defined UIA_X_ID enums as uints (https://github.com/microsoft/win32metadata/issues/1723). This has now been fixed and is included in current cswin32 version so removing our definition of UIA_X_ID enums in favor of cswin32. 
Verified with Narrator + Accessibility Insights that behavior is expected.

Issues.RelatedDescription: Closed or merged PR "Use Cswin32 UIA_X_ID Enums" (#10520)

Re-layout OpenCats and Clear buttons by setting Anchor property

Issues.Title: [Accessibility] CheckBox control should support ValuePattern property
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

.Net 9.0 SDK with 9.0.100-alpha.1.23620.7 build

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

No

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No

### Issue description

CheckBox control doesn't support ValuePattern property, compared with the CheckedListBox item, which is supported.

**CheckBox:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/764fc5d4-7ce3-4048-b670-951dd565651b)


**CheckedListBox item:**
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/26474449/3a30b49b-71a7-411e-b188-8d70801f392c)


### Steps to reproduce

1. Create a Winforms .Net application
2. Add a checkBox and a checkedListBox control with some items added
3. Build and run application
4. Use Accessibility Insight tool to observe the ValuePattern property for checkBox and one item of checkedListBox
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "[Accessibility] CheckBox control should support ValuePattern property" (#10516)

It reproduces steadily in our automation case about XLinkLabel, but we cannot repro manually.

Issues.Title: VS stop running while opening message box with Options's value to DefaultDesktopOnly/ServiceNotification
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.23620.7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

No, It also repro on .NET 8.0.

### Issue description

VS stop running while opening message box with Options's value to DefaultDesktopOnly/ServiceNotification


## Repro steps:
1. Git clone  https://github.com/dotnet/winforms
2. Open CMD from clone folder and run "start-vs.cmd" command open project
3. Select WinformsControlTest app, right click it to set as startup project
4. Build and run, click "MessageBox button
5. Set Options's value to DefaultDesktopOnly/ServiceNotification, Click Show MessageBox

https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/51b017d2-8540-4e53-90ad-bb4050f695a5


## Actual result: 
VS stop running

## Expected  result: 
Message box will be opened without error
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "VS stop running while opening message box with Options's value to DefaultDesktopOnly/ServiceNotification" (#10513)

Issues.Title: The down arrow icon align with Details is not tangible in Thread exception dialog
Issues.Body:
### .NET version

9.0.100-alpha.1.23620.7

### Did it work in .NET Framework?

Not tested/verified

### Did it work in any of the earlier releases of .NET Core or .NET 5+?

Yes, it works well on .NET 8.0.

### Issue description

The down arrow icon align with Details is not tangible in Thread exception dialog 


## Repro steps:
1. Git clone  https://github.com/dotnet/winforms
2. Open CMD from clone folder and run "start-vs.cmd" command open project
3. Select WinformsControlTest app, right click it to set as startup project
4. Build and run, click  "Dialog" button -> "Thread exception dialog" button

## Actual result:  
The down arrow icon align with Details is not tangible.

![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/faaf5b7b-d887-4ca4-ac87-a160a1d95451)

## Expect result: 
The down arrow icon align with Details is tangible.
![image](https://github.com/dotnet/winforms/assets/130345015/4f544a1e-5210-4fb9-a7b5-8c6201a27b0c)

## More Info:
1. This issue exists in DPI 100%.
Issues.RelatedDescription: Open issue "The down arrow icon align with Details is not tangible in Thread exception dialog " (#10512)
